dublin_core.dcvalue: Today mini invasive surgery has the chance to be enhanced with sophisticated informative systems Computer Assisted Surgery CAS like robotics tele mentoring and tele presence ZEUS and da Vinci present in more than 120 Centres in the world have been used in many fields of surgery and have been tested in some general surgical procedures Since the end of 2003 we have performed 70 experimental procedures and 24 operations of general surgery with ZEUS robotic system after having properly trained 3 surgeons and the operating room staff Apart from the robot set up the mean operative time of the robotic operations was similar to the laparoscopic ones no complications due to robotic technique occurred The Authors report benefits and disadvantages related to robots utilization problems still to be solved and the possibility to make use of them with tele surgery training and virtual surgery
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:34:57Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-01-10
[Robotics in general surgery: personal experience, critical analysis and prospectives].
